body_content.explanation: A countable noun can be used with "a" or "an" and can be made plural:
examples: An example of a countable noun is "table", and an example of an uncountable noun is "money".
Certain nouns may be countable in English and uncountable in another language, or vice versa.

body_content.explanation: If things are countable, it is possible to say how many there are of them:
examples: The items were too numerous to be countable.
The number of violent attacks in the city each year is relatively low, usually countable on two hands.

body_content.explanation: allowed to be included as part of a total or group:
examples: The recount will look at all the possible countable ballots.
If people are unsure what income is considered countable, they are advised to check with an accountant.
